Coders Club- CODE ARCHITECTS
Home -
Coders Club- CODE ARCHITECTS
Coders Club- CODE ARCHITECTS
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Coders Club- CODE ARCHITECTS
Vision
“To provide finest training activities, research facilities and opportunities supported by continuous industry – institute interaction aimed to compete in international coding championships like ACM-ICPC, Google Code Jam and contribute to the economic and technological development of the region, state and nation.”
Mission
We believe in working and learning together.
We inspire discovery and invention through play
We believe in the transformational power of programming.
Objectives
“To Promote excellence in Computer Science and Engineering education and advance the development along with exchange of relevant knowledge as well as to provide all the students with the skills, confidence and opportunity to shape the world together”
Preamble
Welcome to one of the biggest clubs of Sphoorthy Engineering College, Hyderabad. Members of this club are the most talented and computer geeks of SPHN. If you see coding as fun then you landed in the right place, this club prepares you to compete with the best brains in SPHN.
Learning the basics of computer programming is not only fun and interesting to the students but gives them a window to future paths that will be open to them. Some people are saying that along with foreign languages, coding is a language needed for jobs of the future.
The students will use different programs to begin to learn to code. At the end of the semester there will be a coding challenge and a possible competition with other colleges.
A program dedicated to the idea that all students can benefit from learning about computational thinking.
Membership of Coders Club- CODE ARCHITECTS
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as competitions ,quizzes and Industrial visits) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.

Creators Club
About Club
Office Bearers

About Creators Club
Vision
To create a Culture of Innovation and Entrepreneurship by finding Solutions to the problems that is / arising in the Society.
Mission
Our Mission is to impart the problem-solving Skills in the minds of Students to promote Innovation and Entrepreneurship.
Objectives
To promote Technology, Innovation & Entrepreneurship.
To Motivate Students to take part in the Innovation Activities like technical Trainings, Ideathons, Hackathons, Entrepreneurship Development Programs and many more.
To make students understand the importance of IPR-Patents, Start-up and their Importance in shaping the lives of people and Economy of the Country.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
Club Members will have an Early access/ priority to participate in all the Technical Programs organized by the Club.
Membership of Creators Club
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

About Cultural Club-PRATHIBA YOGYATA
Vision
The cultural club is here to encourage the special talents of students and also support their passion.
Mission
The mission of your cultural event focusing on dance and singing could be to celebrate. This event aims to provide a platform for individuals to express their cultural heritage and creativity, fostering connections among different groups of people and promoting a sense of unity.
Objectives
The objective of a cultural club is to promote, celebrate, and preserve various aspects
such as music, dance, instrumental music, standup comedy.

Eco Club
Home -
Eco Club
Eco Club
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Eco Club
Vision
The club will be committed towards raising social awareness regarding environmental issues and changing student’s attitude towards the environment by enlisting their active participation in club’s activities.
Mission
Going green and to maintain a sustainable green campus. To create a natural, holistic, student-centered learning environment that inspires our students to be creative, innovative, green leaders and eco-friendly decision.
Organize rallies, marches, human chains and street theatre at public places with a view to spread environmental awareness.
Action based activities like tree plantation, cleanliness drives both within and outside the college campus.
Objectives
Educate students to create awareness amongst public and sanitary workers, so as to stop the indiscriminate burning of waste which causes respiratory diseases.
Promote ethos of conservation of water by minimizing the wastage of water.
Encouraging creativity, and improving students for constructive action.
Motivate the students to keep their surroundings clean and green and making them understand the importance of planting trees.
Sensitize the students to minimize the use of plastic bags, not to throw them in public places as they choke drains and sewers, cause water logging and provide breeding ground for mosquitoes.
Organize tree plantation programs, awareness programs through quiz, essay and painting competitions, rallies etc. regarding various environmental issues which help them understand the importance about re-use of waste material & preparation of products out of waste.
Maintain organic composting pits.
E - ENVIRONMENTAL
C - CONSERVATION
O - ORGANIZATION
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
ECO club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Eco Club
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

About Club
Office Bearers

About Fitness Club– “YOGYATA”
Vision
Our vision is to empower individuals to transform their lives through fitness, fostering a community of strength, wellness, and personal growth. We strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where individuals of all fitness levels can discover their potential, exceed their goals, and embrace a lifelong commitment to health and well-being.
Mission
To instil an understanding of the importance of holistic wellbeing and healthy lifestyle through fitness & wellness programs and to create the awareness among others.
Objectives
To create awareness about the health status and health related issues among students, faculties and other staff members.
To accord high priority to physical and mental fitness.
To encourage and adopt policies and practices towards fitness and well-being.
To educate students about having balanced diet, home remedies for common ailments and choices for healthy living.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
Fitness club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Fitness Club– “YOGYATA”
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as Yoga classes and Health awareness programs) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

Gamers Club
Home -
Gamers Club
Gamers Club
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Gamers Club
Vision
Create an environment to learn how to win with grace and lose with dignity over fun games. These values will continue into the everyday life of the students.
Mission
Provide a safe and fun environment away from the stresses of academia for all game lovers whether it be playing Games or Designing Games.
Objectives
Lead the students of SPHN into making strong, smart, and effective decisions.
Influence students to make better choices by representing leadership characteristics, including responsibility, trustworthiness, and respectability.
To promote and coordinate student participation in recreational, social & cultural activities.
To develop skills in group cooperation and ethical and transparent interaction.
Providing members with opportunities to participate in relevant academic, professional, cultural, and networking activities.
Collaborate with organisations, Clubs, Government Bodies, NGOs, and private organisations to help students find meaningful volunteer opportunities, externships, and employment as applicable.
Preamble
Every Student can be a member in a maximum of 3 clubs and a minimum 1 club. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together all clubs.
Gamers Clubs will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Gamers Club
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organisation activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership. Clubs that do not have sufficient membership, considered to be at least 50 as of January 20, or do not carry out any educationally purposeful activities for ONE semester will be placed on probation. A club that remains on probation for two semesters will be dissolved.
Clubs that violate these bylaws may face dissolution.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

Handlers Club-"ROBO TECH"
Home -
Handlers Club-"ROBO TECH"
Handlers Club-"ROBO TECH"
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Handlers Club-"ROBO TECH"
Vision
To cultivate a vibrant community of students passionate about robotics and automation. Our vision is to spread knowledge, ignite curiosity, and inspire innovation in the fields of robotics technology, drone systems, ...
We aim to create an environment where students can explore and excel in the realm of robotics, enhancing their skills and contributing to technological advancements.
Mission
Our Club is committed to fostering a dynamic community of robotics and automation enthusiasts. We aim to provide a hands-on learning experience where members can design, build, and operate robotic systems and drones. Through interactive workshops, hackathons, engaging competitions, and organizing games, we empower students to develop technical skills, leadership qualities, and a passion for innovation. Our mission is to create an inclusive space that combines education and enjoyment, encouraging members to thrive and contribute to the advancement of robotics technology.
Objectives
Promote Robotic Knowledge: Foster a strong understanding of robotics and technology among students, encouraging them to explore its applications and advancements.
Exploration of Automation: Introduce students to the world of automation, guiding them to create solutions that enhance efficiency and reduce manual efforts.
Hands-on Learning: Provide practical experience by organizing workshops on assembling, programming, and operating robots using various platforms and tools.
Robotics Workshop Series: Organize a series of hands-on workshops throughout the semester, covering various aspects of robotics, from basic concepts to advanced programming and design techniques.
Guest Lectures and Industry Insights: Invite experts from the robotics industry to deliver guest lectures, providing students with insights into the latest trends, research, and career opportunities.
Coding Challenges: Conduct coding challenges that focus on programming robotics platforms, enhancing members' coding skills and their ability to control and automate devices.
Hackathon Excellence and Skill Development: Organize hackathons, design challenges, and training sessions that empower members to excel in robotics competitions. Through these activities, members will enhance their problem-solving abilities, rapid prototyping skills, and effective project management, positioning them as leaders in hackathons.
Competitions and Challenges: Prepare members for regional and national robotic competitions, fostering healthy competition and showcasing the club's technical expertise.
Intra-Club Competitions: Host friendly competitions within the club, challenging members to create innovative robotic solutions that address specific challenges. Furthermore, arrange games within the domain to help members learn more, increase their interest.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
ROBO “ TECH ” ( Handlers club ) will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Handlers Club-"ROBO TECH"
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability, or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organizational activities, or opportunities to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be members and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum is to be paid by every student to become and maintain membership.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows), the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of outsiders (experts, trainers, volunteers from NGOs, etc.) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

About Literary and Fine Arts Club- LITERATI & EUPHORIA
Vision
To promote and enhance the creative skills in the students and creative decision making.
Mission
This club is intended to identify, appreciate, build and develop the creative skills and talent hidden in the student.
Objectives
The club is formed to develop and recognise the creative skills in the students.
The office bearers and members of the club will learn to organize and manage the events and learn how to plan the parogramme.

Multimedia Club- “Trinetra”
Home -
Multimedia Club- “Trinetra”
Multimedia Club- “Trinetra”
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Multimedia Club- “Trinetra”
Vision
To encourage and motivate students to involve in multimedia activities and enhance their knowledge and skills.
Mission
The Multimedia Club consists of a creative group of students on campus and committed to learn about digital media, photography in a fun environment where students have the creativity to imagine, create & produce digital media stories, commercials, short films. Students will learn how to operate video cameras, microphones, editing software, and work together in a group.
Objectives
To promote knowledge & understanding of Multimedia tools & its wide usage.
To spread insights on multimedia among students. The basics of software is taught which are related to designing and editing like Photoshop, coral draw, movie making after effects.
To introduce the students to multimedia and animation world which allow them to combine photos, narration, animation and videos to create movies through different animation tools.
To develop skills to encourage the production of creative media messages.
To develop an understanding of the effects of mass media on themselves as individuals and also upon society.
To provide a chance to apply knowledge gained in classroom lectures & workshops to real world scenarios.
To improve creativity.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office ulosition put together in all clubs.
Multimedia club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Multimedia Club- “Trinetra”
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

NSS Club-"DEVNA"
Home -
NSS Club-"DEVNA"
NSS Club-"DEVNA"
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About NSS Club-"DEVNA"
Vision
To develop an “Aatmanirbhar (Self-Dependent) Society.”
Mission
The NSS is working with a mission to solve problems of community and society by using knowledge, skills, technology and people to make a self-reliant and self-sufficient society.
Objectives
Identify the needs and problems of the community and involve them in problem-solving
Develop among themselves a sense of social and civic responsibility.
Utilize their knowledge in finding practical solutions to individual and community problems.
Develop competence required for group-living and sharing of responsibilities.
Gain skills in mobilizing community participation.
Acquire leadership qualities and democratic attitudes.
Develop capacity to meet emergencies and natural disasters.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
NSS Club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of NSS Club-"DEVNA"
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or physical disability, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as Village Surveys, Visiting the Orphanage, Visiting Old Age Home, etc.) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

About SPHN Radio Club
Vision
At STEREO HEARTS, our vision is to provide the most valued and vibrant service. We are the one who inspire people, with the different flavors of voice while providing information and entertainment.
Mission
To provide a trusted and indispensable source of information, music, and entertainment while strengthening the civic and cultural life of the communities we serve.
Objectives
The purpose of the STEREO HEARTS is interrelated. Listen to the programs, make a list of them and find out if they were a source of information, entertainment or education.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
Radio club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of SPHN Radio Club
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

Sports Club-"Sankalp"
Home -
Sports Club-"Sankalp"
Sports Club-"Sankalp"
About Club
Office Bearers
Mentors
Club Events
Gallery
About Sports Club-"Sankalp"
Vision
To encourage the students to be a part of games and sports to improve all-round personality.
Mission
To provide games and sports facilities to the students so that they actively participate in them.
Objectives
To provide a healthy sporting habit, recreational opportunities for the students retain their interest towards sports.
To maintain communication with the College officials to conduct sports and games much effectively in a scheduled way.
To develop sports skills and sportsman spirit.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
Sports Club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Sports Club-"Sankalp"
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.

About Women`s Chapter Club- Sheinspires
Vision
To encourage and motivate students to involve in SHE INSPIRES WOMEN’S CLUB  activities and enhance their knowledge and skills.
Mission
1. The SHE INSPIRES women’s Club consists of a creative group of students on campus and committed to learn about to inspire women through guest lectures, seminars, awareness programs, webinars and other welfare activities.
2. To empower woman fraternity to face challenges in personal and professional life
3. To create an awareness on the importance of spirituality, health, hygiene and safety.
Objectives
Sphoorthy Woman’s club ‘SHE INSPIRES’established with a motto to empower and uplift female fraternity of the institute to reach pinnacle in their career.
Preamble
Every member of this club can be a member of maximum any other two clubs. However, one cannot hold more than one office position put together in all clubs.
Women’s club will follow the Calendar Year.
Membership of Women`s Chapter Club- Sheinspires
Membership is open to any currently enrolled SPHN Students. Only one level of membership is available.
This Club shall not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, disability or handicap, religion, gender orientation, department, procedures, and practices. This policy will include but is not limited to recruiting, membership, organization activities, or opportunity to hold office.
Only currently enrolled students are allowed to be a member and run for club offices.
Current members may bring up new business during the open floor session of regularly scheduled meetings.
A non-refundable membership fee of Rs 10 per annum to be paid by every student to be and maintain the membership.
For certain activities (such as plays, concerts, and shows) the club Office, after consultation with the Management, may solicit the help and participation of Outsiders (Experts, Trainers, Volunteers from NGOs, etc.,) needed on an ad-hoc basis because of their specific talents or skills. Such persons will not have any right to participate, influence, and guide this Club Office.
The duration of membership shall be from January 1 to December 31 of every year.
